quote: I have gathered a posie of other men’s flowers, and nothing but the thread that binds them is mine own.
author: John Bartlett

quote: I have gathered a posie of other men’s flowers, and nothing but the thread that binds them is mine own.
author: John Bartlett

quote: Every quotation contributes something to the stability or enlargement of the language.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Proverbs are the abridgments of wisdom.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Our best thoughts came from others.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Next to the originator of a good sentence is the first quoter of it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If we steal thoughts from the moderns, it will be cried down as plagiarism; if from the ancients, it will be cried up as erudition.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: I have heard that nothing gives an Author so great Pleasure, as to find his Works respectfully quoted by other learned Authors.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Better be first in a village than second in Rome.
author: Julius Cæsar

quote: A proverb is a remnant of the ancient philosophy preserved amidst very many destructions on account of its brevity and fitness for use.
author: Publius Syrus.

quote: Tailors and writers must mind the fashion.
author: Unknown

quote: There is no proverb which is not true.
author: Unknown

quote: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
author: Old Testament
